I’m sitting here after finishing the game not being able to think of anything else. Pretty sure it’s a sign of a really good game. Of a really good story. From Schrodinger’s cat and Gilliam’s Twelve Monkeys to ancient Ouroboros, Spierigs’ Predestination and recent Arrival, we heard this story so many times, yet Irrational Games told it perfectly by messing around with time and multiverse. Flip this coin, it has an endless number of sides.

It’s all about balance. There is balance between shooting faceless enemies and thinking of possible scenarios, worrying sick about this amazing girl and fighting for someone else’s ideas, between this colorful bright world and darkness inside every one of us. Fun of killing in many different ways, fun of doing magic, fun of running around with such an usual companion and yet this strange unsettling feeling that bodes danger are all distributed equally. But it is not the danger it bodes, it is the tranquility of knowing things, of understanding that everything has its own place and time and everything should come to its logical end, except an infinite number of infinite universes. It’s all about balance. And balance means comprehension, comprehension means acceptance, what leads us to harmony. Equilibrium of forces in this and other realities and the serpent biting its tail. You know how it’s gonna end and it’s not you who is driving this train into the cold dark void but it doesn’t mean you can’t enjoy the ride or at least the view from the window. You only live once (in every world) so make it count despite the fact you have no choice only fate. And don’t worry if something goes wrong Elizabeth will be there to erase you from this or any other plane of existence. That’s my girl!
Uma experiencia memorável. O jogo só começa depois que vc termina pela primeira vez

I liked it. Having never played any Bioshock game before, I was worried that it would give away ending and crap... but it doesnt!!  Story-wise, it's not tied to the other games of the franchise, making everything good for incase i want to play the first ones. 
It has a good story in my opinion. It may have some cliche moments here and there, but honestly what game doesn't. I felt genually connected to each character, loving the good guys, HATING the villans, and overall the atmoshere was just nice. It has been a while since i have played a game with a good linear, single-player story, and I do highly recommend it.

BioShock Infinite foi sem dúvidas um dos melhores jogos que eu já joguei. Lembro que foi meu primeiro BioShock e não sabia o que esperar do jogo, mas com certeza não fiquei decepcionado, pelo contrário, fiquei extremamente impressionado com o quão imersivo, bem feito e divertido o jogo é.

Dentre os muitos pontos positivos os que pra mim mais se destacam são: o mundo do jogo, no caso, a cidade voadora de Columbia, que é tão bem feita e criada até os mínimos detalhes que você se imagina lá. Imagina como seria viver lá. 

Isso é fruto da brilhante combinação de uma trilha sonora linda + as músicas de época (1912) com a direção de arte impecável, que conseguiu dar ao jogo um visual único e marcante sem necessidade de fotorrealismo no gráfico, que continua muito bonito.

O gameplay é fluído e divertido, graças aos diversos vigores (poderes especias), a vastidão dos cenários e a mecânica dos sky rails. Além da performance do jogo ser muito boa, desde que ele saiu em março de 2013 até hoje o jogo roda muito bem em PCs high-end, mid-end, low-end.

E um dos melhores e mais importantes aspectos desse jogo é sem dúvida sua história. A narrativa é intrigante do início até o fim e a química que existe entre Booker e Elizabeth é tão boa que dá gosto ouvir as conversas deles, já que os personagens são bem pensados e muito bem dublados.

Enfim, BioShock Infinite é muito bom, muito recomendado.

Nota: 9/10
Çok güzel bir oyun size mühteşem bir hikaye ve paradox sunucak kesinlikle oynayın.
Esse jogo é fantástico!! Merece todas as críticas positivas que tem.

生化奇兵：无限是目前最让我感觉惊艳的游戏，没有之一！！！原来游戏还可以表现的这么美轮美奂，特别是刚进入天空之城的布可俯视“天空之城”哥伦比亚的一瞬，感觉如果有天堂也大抵不过如此。随着布克的搜寻展开，这座城市的黑暗一点一点披露出来，无比光鲜的表面与充满歧视、剥削的黑暗内幕形成强烈的对比，最后的平行世界、蝴蝶效应式的结局恍如南柯一梦惊醒，这一刻我才明白“无限”的意味。
关于购买的一些建议：一共四个dlc，第一个是季票。季票包括下面3个dlc：激战云端和海葬1、2。激战云端是一个比赛类型的dlc。所以买的话只买季票就行，最后的那个dlc是武器dlc，对剧情没有影响，没了照玩不误。不过还是支持一些游戏工作组吧。注意最后的武器dlc购买了后，商店不会显示你拥有这个dlc，但在游戏的dlc列表中会有几个武器的名称，实际游戏到蓝丝带酒馆可以拿到这些额外奖励。
A game with great visuals and an interesting, rewarding plot, especially if you've played the first Bioshock.

A pretty great game, got a good, interesting storyline and good characters. Graphics are also very nice for the time it was made. Just make sure you are not running the latest Nvidea drivers when playing it...

Absolutely stunning game. My only regret is waiting this long until playing it! The visuals are beautiful and fluent, and the physics in the background really immerses you into their world (which is fucking breath taking by the way). Also the  deep and emotional character development paired with some of the best storytelling I've seen seen in years puts this game near the top of my list. It's a must play for everybody. A Masterpiece.

Just got around to finishing the game, was well worth it. 

The visuals are great, and the concept of the city Colombia is great. I truly enjoyed my time spent there just as I did in Rapture from the original Bioshock games. The story kept me interested troughout, which says something as there is not many games that can do so today. I was never a big fan of having to search for small pieces of the story by finding audiotapes though especially when the story is this good. But that is just a minor detail and does not take away from the great story and world that has been created in this game.

When it comes to the gameplay I have to say it is fun. There has been some complaints about it and I don't really see why, in my opinion the gameplay is better then the first two games. Especially the use of ADAM. The abilities looks great and feels rewarding. The gunplay also feels pretty smooth and is not clunky at all. I will say that towards the end of the game it gets a bit stale as you I never liked having to shoot an enemie in the head multiple times to get the kill. That might just be me thought as I am a big fan of long range sniping weapons as the sniper rifle and the hand cannon.

Overall the game is great. If you are going to get it I would reccomend getting the dlc's as well. They might be a bit short, but they really sum up the bioshock series in a nice way and end it how a great series like this deserves.

很棒的一部作品，光影效果满分，画面满分（也许是因为是我喜欢的画风的原因），有人说这一部作品的射击手感不太好，我不方便评论，因为我本是一个射击游戏苦手，不过，这是我唯一一个通关了的fps游戏，也许也是因为射击手感的问题？故事也无可挑剔，深度与趣味性并存，可以看出在剧情上工作室花了相当多的功夫，令人惊讶的是通过DLC使三部作品成功的链接到了一起，而“无限”这一主题之真相的揭示更是给了我十足的震撼。
要说唯一不满意的地方大概就是优化似乎不太好，不过考虑到优秀的画面也是可以接受的。
最后不得不说一句，伊丽莎白果然最棒了！[spoiler] 鬼父你还是安心去死吧把你女儿交给我保管就行~[spoiler]

Burial at Sea was a new experience for me this week, and I was not disappointed.  The years of thought, effort and raw creativity that went into the design and concept of this game turned out a phenomenal product.  

If you're looking for a very thought-provoking, action-packed single player title, or if you're just a fan of the Bioshock series, this is the game for you.  Trust me, it'll all tie in.

I've played through the main game multiple times on Xbox, and I just had to buy it on PC once I had the chance. I bought this game in the Bioshock triple pack, and it was an increble deal - three great games for roughly ten dollars. I haven't gotten around to playing the other two Bioshock games yet, but I've heard great things about them.
The bioshock series has been amusing, this was a pretty interesting addition. I am a bit dismayed at the game's departure from its stranger origins. It was a fun play through, anyway.

This is an excellent game!  Slight spoiler alert, be advised.  The storyline is strong, and I was impressed by the complexities that were thrown in using variations of characters from multiple timeline/dimensions.  The floating city of Columbia is absolutely gorgeous...quite dreamlike.  I would have loved to have even more time to spend wandering the city before everything fell to ****.  The storyline is in the same universe as Rapture (and has some ties to events and characters in Rapture) but is mostly independent.  The DLC (Burial at Sea), however, is an awesome connection between the events in Rapture and Columbia.  Burial at Sea (1 and 2) is an excellent add-on to Bioshock Infinite, and I strongly suggest you play the DLC, too.  Seriously, get it.  Burial at Sea takes place in Rapture, for the most part, and gives you additional perspective on how the events in Rapture and Columbia are tied together, via multiple dimensions.  

This game makes you think, and that's a good thing.  There aren't too many of those nowadays, it seems.  

I strongly recommend this game.  I simply caution you that the story is not really a continuation from the first or second Bioshock.  The feel of the game is a bit different, too.  It's Bioshock, but it is in a different city and a different time.  Remember that, and this will be one of your favorite games, as it is mine.

장점 : 2013년 치고는 뛰어난 그래픽,  매력적인 스토리 라인. 
단점 : 이전 작과는 너무나도 다른 분위기. 1/2가 디젤 펑크를 대표했다면 전형적인 스팀 펑크인 점에서 다소 호불호가 갈릴 듯. 
개인적으로 제일 아쉬웠던 점은 역시나  스카이후크를 제외하면 무기를 단 2개 밖에 지니고 다니지 못한다는 점이 아쉬움. 또한 어느 정도 자유로운 행동은 보장되지만 진행 경로가 직선적인 점은 조금 아쉬움. 그리고 한글 번역도 조금 아쉽. 가령 손대포나  상수/변수 구분을 하지 않은 점 등.
그럼에도 불구하고 바이오쇼크 시리즈 중 최고점을 주고 싶음. 컬럼비아로 대표되는 백인 우월주의의 이상향과 그 어두운 면을 다루며 더 나아가 평행우주에까지 접근한  점은 가히 천재적.
Compra el puto juego.

It's a good game, a mediocre Bioshock, it could have been much better if it didn't follow certain trends and they didn't forget to prioritize it being a videogame over a compelling story, and it shows

The Good:
*The setting is the game's strongest point, a vibrant ultra-nationalist Edwardian era city floating in the sky, the feeling is similar to exploring Rapture for the first time
*The Vigors are pretty good, but Charge and Undertow could have been expanded better, its sad to have a water tentacle power and not being able to pummel enemies with it
*The story is pretty good even though it feels kinda weak late game because they tried to cram too much themes into it
*The revolution subplot doesn't sticks to the "revolutionaries are the good guys" cliche, which is a breath of fresh air
*Booker is a pretty good protagonist with an interesting past, I liked that better than the previous games tradition of making the protagonist a silent almost-blank slate
*It has some pretty good characters even if a lot like Fink and Fitzroy were not explored enough and were thrown to the sidelines

The Neutral:
*The game is pretty linear in comparison to the previous entries, I don't think this is neccesarily a bad thing but it can be to a lot of people
*The way the story handles racism and religious fervor is pretty clumsy, all the white bystanders seem to talk of almost nothing but their prophet and the evils of the other races, wherever it's despiction of these themes works for the game or not is pretty subjective, and to be fair the first two games treated Ryan's and Lamb's philosophies with little subtlety too

The Bad:
*As i said above, the story got too convulted for it's own good, by late game the conflict of the founders vs the vox populi seems like a trivial quarrel completely alien to you concerns
*The actions and choices you make in the game ammount to no difference, even though the dialogue of some characters and the advice messages keep suggesting otherwise, likewise at the beginning of the game you get to choice different actions at certain situations, this feature completely dissapears after a little while
*The weapons by far are the worst aspect the game, they handle more similarily to every other generic shooter, and instead of haveing a few realiable weapons with different ammo types that allow you to adapt to the situation, you get a plethora of mediocre and similarily functioning weapons from which you can only carry two at the time, I guess this is supposed to provide variety and force you to be creative, but in reality you will probably just end up specializing in whichever two close and long range weapons suit you better, the sniper rifle is laughably more useful than the rest of the weapons too
*The armored RPG-wielding enemies are just a pain the ass, they take as much damage to die as a hard-hitter enemy but always spawn in hordes as normal enemies and have ridiculously good aim
*Apart from the upgrades that reduce reload time all of the upgrades are insubstantial and the cool feature of the appearance of your weapon changing as you upgrade it is completely gone
*The meele sky-hook attack is just pathetic, it's hard to land and barely does any damage, even if you are directly in frotn of the enemy you are better off using whatever weapon you have at hand or using a vigor than using it at all 
*Sky rails are hardly ever used outside of necessary island to island transportation even though it's one of the most prominently advertised aspects of the game
*You never actually fight the Songbird nor there is any kind of final boss, because the creators thought it would make the game too "videogamey" apparently

Thoroughly enjoyed the game. Disappointed there appears the be only the one ending (may be wrong, only played through on Hard difficulty). As a small consolation, it was nice the choices made in the game seem to change the aesthetics of the characters.

BioShock Infinite ; otra historia, otro tiempo, mismo universo. Es la tercera (y última) entrega de la Saga BioShock, en este videojuego nos cuentan la historia de un "Detective Privado" llamado Booker DeWitt, en el año 1912 en donde por múltiples deudas acumuladas en su vida, salta una oportunidad de saldarlas al presentarte un encargo de un benefactor misterioso, su misión es llegar a la ciudad escondida entre las nubes Columbia (una ciudad "útopica, perfecta pero al borde del colapso) y encontrar a una chica llamada Elizabeth Comstock. Sin embargo el "líder" del lugar, llamado Zachary Comstock (alias El "Profeta") hacen llover sobre DeWitt todo su arsenal y sus planes para evitar que ello ocurra, ya que Elizabeth es mucho más importante de lo que cree.

Juego lanzado en el 2013, se nos presenta con una ambientación perfecta, un clima muy bien logrado, gráficos asombrosos (en comparación a anteriores entregas), y una jugabilidad muy bien pulida, en donde tendremos muchas armas de distintos tipos (sin embargo, con un sólo tipo de munición), y 8 vigorizantes (los nuevos "plasmidos") que nos otorgarán una infinidad de combinaciones y formas de acabar con todo lo que aparezca.

En su música y sonidos, tanto como en sus elementos más allá del juego, se podría decir que lanzaron TODO por la borda, es un bombardeo insistente de muchas canciones, melodías y objetos o entidades que hacen del juego muy bien detallista, y en muchas veces te hace perder el tiempo admirando su acabado. Todo acorde a su temática un tanto "Colonial".

Simplemente una obra maestra, algo que sin duda (en lo personal) quedará dentro de mis sagas favoritas.
So fucking goooood. The story, voice acting, soundtracks. The art. A thing of beauty.

BioShock Infinite is set in 1912 and takes place in a fictional steampunk city-state called "Columbia"—named in homage to the female personification of the United States—which is suspended in the air through a combination of giant blimps, balloons, reactors, propellers, and "quantum levitation."The city of Columbia was founded by self-proclaimed prophet Zachary Hale Comstock, who used his connections in Congress to have the American government build it.The government intended Columbia to serve as a floating world's fair and as a display to the rest of the world of the success of American exceptionalism.The city was launched to much fanfare and publicity at the World's Columbian Exposition in 1893, and was later dispatched to distant shores, travelling from continent to continent.

Initially seen as the pride of the United States, tensions eventually rose between Columbia and the American government. In 1901, against the government's wishes, Columbia brutally and violently put an end to the Boxer Rebellion in Peking. This event revealed the floating city as a heavily armed aerial battleship, capable of unleashing devastation across the world.[8] The American government subsequently demanded Columbia's return to sovereign soil, and, in response, Columbia seceded from the United States and disappeared into the clouds, its location soon lost to everyone else.Free from outside influence, Comstock now had complete control over the city, transforming it from a floating world's fair to a theocratic police state.

Under Comstock's rule, Columbia became a militant pseudo-Christian utopian society that worshiped him as a divine prophetic figure and the Founding Fathers of the United States as religious icons. Despite Columbia's apparent utopian exteriors, it is soon revealed to be a hidden dystopia.Institutional racism and elitism are widespread in the city, with white supremacy of the upper and middle classes heavily enforced by the government as law.Despite the drive for racial purity in Columbia, people of minority races are brought in to the city as a source for cheap labor. They are the underclass of Columbia, and serve mainly as slaves or indentured servants. As a result of this subjugation, minorities are largely relegated to menial and hard labor with no obvious opportunity for upward mobility. Racial segregation is also heavily enforced within the city, to the point where interracial couples face the risk of a public stoning.

By the time of the game's events, racial tensions have risen to the point where Columbia is on the verge of civil war that's waged between the ruling "Founders" and the insurgent "Vox Populi," two factions with strongly opposing ideologies. The Founders, led by Comstock, are the prevailing political faction in the city, and are the rulers of Columbia. The city's ruling class, they are the racist ultra-nationalists who seek to keep Columbia's privileges purely for White American citizens while denying the same right to foreigners.The Vox Populi (Latin for "Voice of the People"), led by Daisy Fitzroy, are a rag-tag anarchist-communist resistance group who fight to restore the rights of Columbian citizenship to people of all races and religions. However, years of bitter struggle have driven them to fight the opposition more out of blind hatred, resulting in more violent and brutal methods.

In addition to the internal strife, Columbia is ravaged by "Tears" in the fabric of space-time.Being the result of past scientific experiments, these Tears reveal alternate universes, and allow for interaction with them. While most Columbian citizens regard these Tears as mere curiosity, some individuals have exploited the insight offered by them to create radically new weapons and technologies, while several others have replicated futuristic music and songs heard from the Tears, bringing anachronistic elements into the Columbia of 1912.

As with BioShock and BioShock 2, the player is able to locate audio logs—Voxophones—and film projectors—Kinetoscopes—that will expand on the history and nature of Columbia beyond those events occurring within the game.Though the game takes place before the events of the previous two BioShock games (occurring in 1960 for BioShock and in 1968 for BioShock 2), the question of whether Infinite occurs within this same timeline remains unanswered.
what a amazin game, i was so thrilled to buy this and no word of a doubt i didnt regreat buying because of good the story line was. it was a mind-blowing experience to see how it all began and ended.

Игра вышла 3 года назад и поразила нас самая лучшая серия игр из всех которая была на мой счет. Особенно дополнительные копание в которых мы можем вернуться в любимый город -Восторг. И в которых нам еще больше рассказывают предысторию самой первой части  10 больших папочек из десяти. Поиграть, в эту игру советую каждому)))

Großartige Story für ein Fps.

Un juego intenso pero con carisma, ya dijo el creador que este juego en jugabilidad era para atraer a los fans de call of duty, pero la trama y la carisma de cada personaje es lo que marca la diferencia de cualquier shooter, musica espectacular, escenarios asombrosos, y la historia que te deja asombrado y sin palabras cuando llega el final, obligandote a pasartelo otra vez para que entiendas del todo esa trama enrevesada, para mi es el 2 mejor juego de la saga( bioshock 1 por encima suyo porque este es una obra maestra), yo le daria un 8/10 ya que si la jugabilidad se hubiese enfocado en el primero y las armas hubiesen sido mas variadas, sin duda seria uno de mis juegos favoritos y mas memorables. PD. Comprarse el Dlc ya que desciendes al mitico Rapture, otra historia que jamas olvidaré

"Разум субъекта предпримет отчаянную попытку создать воспоминания там, где их нет…" -Р. Лютес, "Преграды на пути между измерениями", 1889.
     Покупал эту игру, потому что в тот момент все про неё только и твердили, мол: "Биошок отлиная серия, в неё стоит поиграть, и вообще что это не игра, а шедевр", и заете что? не зря твердили. С самых первых минут игры я не совсем понимал что к чему (имея ввиду сюжет, конечно). Зачем этот мужик, за котрого мы играем, плывёт на лодке с двумя такими же неизвестными мне людьми к какому-то маяку? (Потом-то пройдя первую часть трилогии игры до меня дошло, что маяк это некая фича) Почему этот маяк отправляет нас куда-то в космос в небесный город? Зачем какому-то четвёртому мужику какая-то девушка для уплаты долга? Почему? Зачем? Что это? Как? - примерно такие вопросы  вы будете задавать проходя эту игру, ну да ладно... Естественно по мере прохождения вам всё объясняется и повествуется. Игра поистинне сносит вам крышу, ибо сюжет здесь нереально качественно проработан, хотя что это я, тут всё нереально качественно проработано: графика, геймлей, разнообразие оружия и энергетиков (местные заклинания), персонажи, да просто всё, но сюжет я выделяю особенно ярко, ведь в суть всей концепции сюжета лично я вник только с четвёртого прохождения, и то немного почитав на вики некоторые нюансы. Я не понимаю, ты что, всё ещё читаешь этот обзор? Ты просто обязан купить игру в которой прекрасно всё. Это не просто игра, это игра - легенда, она не забудится, ведь в наше время мало выпускается игр, где разработчики делают упор не на деньги, заработанные с покупок игры, а на интерес со стороны игроков.
      Игра однозанчно стоит своих денег, и я ни сколько не жалею, что потратил кровно выпрошанные у мамки 1000 рублей (ну ладно пиз*жу, я по скидке покупал) и потраченные 80 часов геймлея.
P.S. Так что же ты выберешь птицу или клетку?
P.P.S. Элизабет навсегда останется в моём сердце.

I've had this game for a few years and never got around to playing it. but my god what a mistake that was.this game is absolutely amazing.it is a rare masterpiece in gaming. the plot build up is spot on. a few scares in between. i can't recomment this game enough.

Beau! Très honetement il m'arrive de lancer le jeu juste pour retourner dans certains niveaux qui sont magnifiques. Vous passerez du temps à faire des captures d'écran tant les effets de lumières, les couleurs et le level design sont superbes. C'est une vraie claque visuelle et pourtant on est pas sur du 4k et compagnie.

Si l'univers steampunk/cyberpunk vous branche alors il faut foncer.

Bien sûr ce n'est pas un open world, les niveaux sont scriptés et linéaires mais c'est au profit d'une expérience de jeu basé sur le scénario et la beauté des niveaux. Le gameplay est simple, compréhensible.

feels like a huge step back from the previous games. aesthetically beautiful but linear areas, with little room for exploration. unlike the first 2 games where the exploration and combat in areas were tied together, infinite prefers to have small, narrow areas that feel disconnected from the huge combat areas where most of the combat takes place. speaking of the combat, the game seems to entirely focuse on the combat, which was a mistake. yes, the combat is better than the previous games but it isn't good enough to warrent throwing away almost everything else that makes bioshock so good. you are thrown into huge arenas where enemies come at you in waves. no build up. no tension. also, only being able to carry 2 weapons is downright stupid, and it renders weapon upgrades almsot useless, especially considering how many more weapons there are now. oh yeah, the story. the thing everyone loves about this game. it's not really a bad story, but it is incredibly disconnected  from the gameplay. 80% of the game is booker brutally murdering hundreds of enemys, the rest is story moments. the gameplay just doesn't mix with the story. take the ending for example. it may be riddled with plot holes but it seems to be aiming for a sort of arty vibe. so why is the actual gameplay so generic?
